means: [女子名] 戈黛娃来源于古英语，含义是“上帝+礼物”(God+gift)

sentence.Network_en: Tom was peeping through a shutter at Lady Godiva.
sentence.Network_cn: 汤姆正透过百叶窗偷看戈迪娃小姐.

sentence.Network_en: Lady Godiva rode naked through the empty streets of Coventry the next day.
sentence.Network_cn: 第二天葛黛瓦夫人一丝不挂骑着马穿过了空无一人的街道.

sentence.Network_en: Only one man , a tailor, had watched Lady Godiva as she rode through the streets.
sentence.Network_cn: 在葛黛瓦夫人骑马穿过大街时, 只有一个裁缝偷看了.

means.word_mean: 1. according to legend she rode naked through Coventry in order to persuade her husband not to tax the townspeople so heavily; the only person to look at her as she rode by was a man named Tom and Peeping Tom has become a synonym for voyeur (circa 1040-108

auth_sentence.content: Lady Godiva was married to Leofric, the 'grim' Earl of Mercer and Lord of Coventry, a man of great power and importance.
